block.p: Cynthia Gray Harris and Eric Andrew Korman were married yesterday in New York. The Rev. Deborah Steen Ross, an interfaith minister, officiated at the Metropolitan Club.

Mrs. Korman, 33, is the art director at Glamour magazine in New York. She graduated from Princeton. She is the daughter of Alice and James D. Harris of Killington, Vt. Her father retired as an account service director at McCann Erickson, the New York advertising agency. Her mother, who is also retired, was a French instructor at Columbia.
Cynthia Gray Harris and Eric Andrew Korman were married yesterday in New York. The Rev. Deborah Steen Ross, an interfaith minister, officiated at the Metropolitan Club.
Cynthia Gray Harris and Eric Andrew Korman were married yesterday in New York. The Rev. Deborah Steen Ross, an interfaith minister, officiated at the Metropolitan Club.

Mrs. Korman, 33, is the art director at Glamour magazine in New York. She graduated from Princeton. She is the daughter of Alice and James D. Harris of Killington, Vt. Her father retired as an account service director at McCann Erickson, the New York advertising agency. Her mother, who is also retired, was a French instructor at Columbia.

Mr. Korman, 34, is the senior vice president of mergers and acquisitions at the InterActive Corporation, an online media and commerce company. He graduated from Emory University and received an M.B.A. from Northwestern University. He is the son of Sharon and Lewis J. Korman of New York. The bridegroom's mother is an oil painter represented by the Works Gallery in New York.
His father is the vice chairman of RAB Holdings, a manufacturer and distributor of food products in New York.
